did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: U.S. Forest Service. George Washington National Forest. Lost River and Massanutten Working Circles Collection 1912-1940
did.abstract: This collection consists of photocopies of four public-domain documents which relate to the U.S. Forest Service.
did.origination: George Washington National Forest (Va. and W. Va.)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], The U.S. Forest Service. George Washington National Forest. Lost River and Massanutten Working Circles Collection , 1912-1940, SC# 2086, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: John Coleman donated this collection in March 1997.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Copies of these public-domain documents were donated to Carrier Library by John Coleman, Lee District Ranger for the George Washington National Forest, in March 1997.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Since the documents are part of the public domain as official Forest Service reports, no deed or legal release was needed.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: These U.S. Forest Service documents relate to the forestâ€™s early years and detail the condition of federally owned lands as well as development plans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These reports document the forest composition and condition of certain portions of federally owned lands in northern Rockingham and Page counties; and in western Frederick and western Shenandoah counties in Virginia and southeastern Hampshire and eastern Hardy counties, West Virginia. Details about local markets for forest products; local history of tanbark, iron, and other industries; and local fire history are also given.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of photocopies of four documents arranged as follows:

blockquote.p: I: Report on the technical examination of the lands of the Allegheny Ore and Iron Co., Rockingham and Page Counties, VA, 1912 (a copy of the original and a transcript of the poorly typed original are included)
II: Development plan for the Massanutten Working Circle, George Washington National Forest, 1940 (at 75 pages, this is the longest document)
III: Revision of Lost River Working Circle, Shenandoah National Forest, 1924
IV: Development plan for Lost River Working Circle, George Washington National Forest, 1939.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: U.S. Forest Service. U.S. Forest Service, George Washington National Forest, Dry River District Collection, SC# 3014, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.
